item.description:
Experience hiking with one of the easiest 4000 Ft White Mountain hikes.

Mt. Waumbek is reached by the Starr King trail (rt: 7.2 miles, 2,650 feet, 4:55 hour book time) with easy grades and good footing. It passes over Starr King, which has good views of the Presidential range, there are no views from the summit of Waumbek itself.


Profile Mt. Waumbek (4,006 ft.), is the highest peak in the Pliny Range of New Hampshire's North Country, offering views to the east from the summit. [divider] Moderate rating for fit hikers: The trip to Waumbek is coupled with an ascent of neighboring Mt. Starr King. Hikers ascend Starr King via the Starr King Trail and continue on past the summit to Waumbek's summit, 1 mile to the east. The summit marks the southern end of the Kilkenny Ridge Trail, which continues on to Mt. Weeks, Terrace Mountain and Mt. Cabot. [divider] Where:Starr King Trailhead, Jefferson , NH 03583 Trailhead: The trail starts on side road off the north side of Rt 2, 0.2 miles east of Rt 115 jct. There is a country store there with the last available restroom and food. The parking lot is behind a small residential area, drive up the hill, past the houses until you see the sign identifying the parking lot. (Lat:44.25182 Lon:-71.2791)

 

Proper clothing, headlamps and footwear are standard equipment on all hikes.Snowshoes and microspikes should be packed for this hike.  expect spring like conditions, that means the winter trail will be rotting/breaking if it is warming up.  It can be a beautiful day, but a nightmare if you are sinking up to your hips in snow. Keep that extra layer of clothing in your pack. It is easy to under estimate the weather conditions.

 



Click for weather forecast
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the winter trailhead on HWY 2 or better yet, carpool
item.name: Let's Hike Mt. Waumbek via Starr King Trail
